As England’s most prolific scorer Alastair Cook steps down from Test captaincy, we take a look at a few highlights from his brilliant career so far. (With inputs from Reuters) From famous to infamous: Sreesanth turns 34 Mon 6 Feb, 2017 4:25 PM IST 
S Sreesanth, the pace bowler from Kerala, turns 34 on February 6, 2017. He has been one of the most controversial faces in Indian cricket. From the match-fixing scandal to his match-winning heroics in India’s first Test victory in South Africa, Sreesanth was quite a colourful character both on and … More » From famous to infamous: Sreesanth turns 34 Photos: India's stunning stats in the 3rd T20I vs England Thu 2 Feb, 2017 5:24 PM IST 
RCB’s wonder boy Yuzvendra Chahal created havoc at his favourite hunting ground, sending the English batsmen packing with an astonishing spell, the first time an Indian has picked up six wickets in a T20I game. … More » Photos: India's stunning stats in the 3rd T20I vs England India vs England, 2nd T20 at Nagpur Sun 29 Jan, 2017 7:30 PM IST The last roll of Ponting's bat Fri 12 Jul, 2013 12:39 PM IST 
Ricky Ponting bowed out in style as the former Australia captain hit 169 not out for Surrey in his final first-class innings against Nottinghamshire on July 11, 2013. 
Ponting, who retired from international cricket in December 2012 with a Test average of 51.85, had reached the landmark of 24,000 … More » The last roll of Ponting's bat India vs England, 1st T20 at Kanpur Thu 26 Jan, 2017 5:13 PM IST India vs England, 3rd ODI in Kolkata Sun 22 Jan, 2017 3:43 PM IST India vs England, 2nd ODI at Cuttack Thu 19 Jan, 2017 2:37 PM IST India vs England, 1st ODI at Pune Sun 15 Jan, 2017 2:22 PM IST Rahul Dravid: Another brick in the wall Wed 11 Jan, 2017 12:35 PM IST The Indian legend turned 44 on January 11th, 2017. [CYCSPL] Photos: Captain Cool's coolest moments Thu 5 Jan, 2017 11:30 AM IST Mahendra Singh Dhoni has left an immeasureable legacy in Indian cricket. The records he has set will be immensely hard to match for any Indian captain in times to come. Take a look. While some were past their prime, there were a few who had it in them to go on for a few years more, but instead opted to call it a day.
